p.strong:
HELLO AND WELCOME TO OUR SURVEY!
YOUR OPINIONS ARE VERY IMPORTANT TO US AND THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR PARTICIPATION. PLEASE ANSWER EACH QUESTION CAREFULLY AND COMPLETELY. REMEMBER THERE ARE NO RIGHT OR WRONG ANSWERS.
USE THE SCROLL BAR ON THE RIGHT AND BOTTOM OF YOUR SCREEN TO MOVE UP AND DOWN THROUGH QUESTIONS.
LET’S BEGIN…

radio.label: S_Gender
radio.title: With which gender do you identify?

checkbox.label: S_Industry
checkbox.title: Do you or does any member of your household work in any of these occupational fields?

radio.label: S_Age_category
radio.title: Record the age group!

radio.label: S_KHC_SEG
radio.title: Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with the following statements.
radio.comment: Select one response in each row.
radio.row: I evaluate the nutrition of menu items when ordering at a restaurant
A celebrity endorsement may influence me to consider or buy a product
I choose the organic version of prepared meals (i.e., frozen, refrigerated or those found on the grocery shelf) when available
When possible, I prefer to buy foods that are minimally processed
When it comes to choosing a meal, convenience is more important than health
I always check the nutritional content of food products before I buy them
Being full and satisfied is more important than the quality of the prepared meal (i.e., frozen, refrigerated or those found on the grocery shelf)
I choose the restaurant I go to based on how many healthy things they offer
I only diet when an important event is coming up, such as a wedding or class reunion
I don't do leftovers at all

select.label: S_PrimaryShopper
select.title: How much of the grocery shopping for yourself and anyone living with you, do you, yourself, do?

radio.label: S_ChannelShopperPercentage
radio.title: How much of your overall Food and Beverages shopping do you do online vs. in a physical store?
radio.row: I do all my shopping online (100%)
I do most of my shopping online (~75%)
I do about half of my shopping online (~50%)
I do some of my shopping online (~25%)

number.label: S_Typical10
number.title: Thinking about your grocery shopping routine as a whole, how would you divide your typical 10 trips across the following retailers?
number.comment: Please enter a number between 0 and 10 for each of the following retailers.

radio.label: Agreement1
radio.title:
Respondent Confidentiality Disclosure Agreement (RCDA)
Congratulations!
Thank you for agreeing to participate in this consumer study on behalf of Behaviorally, formerly PRS. Before you can participate in this research, we would like you to understand that it will involve Confidential Information and you must agree to these terms and conditions. If you do not agree, you will not be eligible to participate in this study. By signing this agreement, you agree as follows:
You will use information or material disclosed to you or which may be available as part of this study only for the purpose of participating in this study, and you will not otherwise use the information or material for your own benefit or the benefit of any third party.
You agree to keep confidential and not disclose, copy, transmit, or use for any purpose other than your participation in this study any information or material disclosed or made available to you as part of the study, including about products or packaging that may be disclosed to you directly or indirectly by participating in this study. Any disclosure, copying, transmitting or misuse of any information or material in any form (including hard copy and/or electronic/data) whether intentional or unintentional may subject you to disqualification, and any other remedies available to Behaviorally or its study partners in law or equity.
You agree that Behaviorally (and its partners) will be irreparably harmed and monetary damages may not be adequate compensation if you fail to meet your obligations under this agreement, and that, in addition to other remedies, Behaviorally (or its partners) shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief to prevent any threatened or continued breach. The parties hereby waive any requirements for security for obtaining any provisional relief.
Each of Behaviorally’s partners is an intended third-party beneficiary of this agreement and each partner may enforce the terms of this agreement.
As further detailed in our privacy policy (https://www.behaviorally.com/privacy-policy), we take reasonable precautions to protect the privacy and security of your information during the market research survey. All information collected as part of this survey is treated in accordance with our online privacy policy and is destroyed 2 years after you have taken this survey. You will be compensated for your time, commitment, and confidential obligation.
Please confirm your acceptance of these terms by checking the agreement below.

radio.label: askSnapshot
radio.title: Record the Snapshot or not

radio.label: S_SnapshotOptIn
radio.title:
We need your help, please! We are trying to understand how people like you shop for [pipe:Category].
For this research only, we would greatly appreciate if you could share your past 90-day web browsing data. No personal details or products bought will be collected, and you will receive an additional incentive of $15 Fifteen Dollars.
This will only take one minute of your time. All we need to do is download a temporary plugin, collect your past 90-day web browsing data, and then the plugin will delete itself immediately after.
Would you like to proceed? Thanks in advance for your help!

textarea.label: RE_Open
textarea.title: Please help us to understand why you decided to not take part in the download of the plugin to share your past 90-day web browsing data. Is there an incentive that would make you more willing to participate? If so, what is that incentive?

survey.html: Now we are going to switch gears – instead of discussing one shopping event, we are going to now focus on activities in your daily life.

radio.label: Q_Media1
radio.title: Thinking about the last week or two, roughly how long did you spend doing these activities on a typical day during the week (Monday to Friday)?
radio.comment: Select one response for each statement.
radio.row: Using the Internet on a laptop or PC for something other than email
Using the Internet or apps on a mobile device for something other than email

radio.label: Q_Media2
radio.title: And, over the last week or two, how long did you spend doing these activities on a typical day on the weekend?
radio.comment: Select one response for each statement.
radio.row: Using the Internet on a laptop or PC for something other than email
Using the Internet or apps on a mobile device for something other than email

radio.label: Q_Media3
radio.title: How often do you usually visit these types of websites?
radio.comment: Select one response for each statement.
radio.row: Social Networks and Online Communities, e.g., Facebook, Tik-Tok, Instagram, etc.
Arts and Entertainment, e.g., Digital TV, Movie streaming, Music streaming, etc.
e-Commerce and Shopping Marketplace, e.g., Amazon.com, etc.
News and Media, e.g., NYTimes, Yahoo, etc.
Science and Education, e.g., Weather.com, Instructor.com, etc.
Retailer Media Networks e.g., Roundel, Amazonadvertising.com, etc.

radio.label: Q_Media4
radio.title: And how often do you usually visit these specific websites?
radio.comment: Select one response for each statement.
